title: Dynamic Queue: Given Positions
body:
With the recent release of the Dynamic Queue, the ability to choose a position under **Primary & Secondary** is much appreciated and has made ranked a slightly more pleasurable experience. However, I do have a strong concern with the queues priority with the **assignment** of roles. 

Lately, 
I've been actively spectating numerous ranked games that my friends play in, majority being ROLE/LANE OTP's (_One Trick Pony's_), and see them being forced into their secondary far too often. 

I understand that from a wider perspective, they should be capable of playing other roles to at least a decent standard, but watching them lose consecutively because they've been forced into their off-role 6 times in a row doesn't appeal to me as a balanced choice making system. 

Could anybody with the knowledge, or a Riot employee shed some light over this; as to why the firm majority of my friends are seen to have the weaker priority after being placed in their **Secondary** more often than the **Primary**?

_**TL;DR: Friends constantly getting assigned their Secondary more often than being assigned Primary. Why?**_

replies.body:
Yeah, had support as my secondary, not even kidding 20 games in a row I got support. Yes I get that supports are much more rare, but I feel like the algorithims should at least see "Oh, this person has gotten X role repeatedly, we should probably chuck them in their other role this time," otherwise what's the point in a primary pick?
I'm sure they'll work something out eventually though. It's just a matter of finding a solution that doesn't increase queue times like Teambuilder did.

Disclaimer: This isn't naming and shaming in any way but decided not to black out the names because anyone could find this game in my matchmaking history anyway.

Matchmaking - http://imgur.com/rwVUPYV
Match History - http://imgur.com/6FVSNGB

{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}} 

If you take a look at these two photos you will understand how disgraceful this match was. I could definitely rant but I think anyone with a brain can see what is wrong here.

Use this as evidence that the matchmaking system is not perfect! 
Try again Rito!

I'm not too sure what you mean here, do you mean the ranks? Because it's common for S2-G4 players to play together, and the S5 most likewly was higher last season and had bad placements (but good mmr). Them being plat last season doesn't necessarily mean much. They both have negative W/L in ranked so likely they are much closer to where they should be now.

Forgive me if I'm missing something, but I don't see anything wrong with this match. (I'm not saying it's never dodgy, cause it is sometimes, I just don't quite see what you mean)

Judging by the ranks alone of the enemy team we were far out matched. They were also placed on the red team indicating they had a higher MMR overall anyway even if their ranks weren't enough. If you look at the match history and can't see anything wrong with the game.... well I don't know what rock you live under.

Since the camera updates it no longer always places the higher mmr team on purple/red side. I've seen this a lot in my own games as well as in others where the higher mmr team was on blue side.

If you specify what exactly it is you are looking at maybe I could try to explain it for you, but I don't see anything wrong. There are a multitude of reasons those two might have been plat last season, but it doesn't mean much when they have a negative winrate in low Gold. The skill difference between high silver and low gold isn't that big.

It comes down to how popular a role is. The system will try to give you your primary within limits. Supp > Jung are the easiest roles to get, as they are the least popular. If you queue with Supp/Jng like I do you'll get Jng maybe 1 out of every 10 games. But if you queue with Top/Mid, it will be pretty much the opposite.

Jungle is by far not the easiest role to get, i run jungle mid and get relatively long queues (and still get a decent amount of mid games).

Pretty sure the rough times are Mid>Jungle>Top>Adc (possibly not given kog'maws popularity but i'm not sure)>Support
Huh well it might have changes since last I looked but I never followed it too closely. Last time I checked Top was most popular with Jung > Supp being least.

Ranked Dynamic queues is unfair for solo (OCE)

For a solo ranked player, it is unfair and no point of ranked since individual skill means nothing. The Dynamic picks is good but needs to be dynamic solo only mode to make ranked mean something. I may not even try in games where its a group of friends vs a smaller group of friends or just solos. riot says It is suppose to mirror the lobbies so that if there is a duo on one side, it should also be a duo on the other team, that is not the case for me.

So if the match making makes it unfair, I make its 4v5. I know I will receive verbal abuse and hate speech, but riot does not care so why should I.
